Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content:
Yep and it fits into what James and the team have been doing.

One thing i would love to see is what is Komodo's just cause / vision that we are working towards to. @polycryptoblog is there anything like that defined anywhere?

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Regardless of the rebrand, i would love to see a over all vision statement that we can all get behind. Once we have that, we attract others that want to see that eventuality just as much as we do

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: @jl777c what do you think?

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: One of the other concepts is, we are not the first, we are not the best, when playing a infinite game, there is only ahead and behind. This is dependent on a "competitor" to Komodo, dont know if there is one üòõ

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
hey guys, here are our current vision/mission statements

TAGLINE: Komodo: An Open, Composable Multi-Chain Platform

MISSION STATEMENT 

Komodo is committed to accelerating global blockchain adoption through a composable multi-chain architecture, an open platform model, and a business-friendly ecosystem that allows developers, startups, and enterprise alike to prosper with customized blockchain solutions.

VISION STATEMENT

Komodo‚Äôs vision is an open and free internet with thousands of application-specific blockchains working in unison to perform complex business functions in a decentralized and trustless manner, all while maintaining a spirit of collaboration and cooperation in the blockchain space.

Author: Audo#5667
Content: it is especially hard to come up with a concise, clear and meaningful vision statement

Author: Audo#5667
Content: let me know what you guys think, we can tweak it around. I agree a vision statement we all can get behind is an important one

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Not knocking whoever wrote that but i would say there would be many other projects with very similar vision statements

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Plus for a normie, that means nothing, too much buzz words

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: But as you said, coming up with something that resonates with everyone is very hard and i dont have an answer to that üòÑ

Author: ph03nix#3115
Content: i like the vision statement

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: One other thing, the vision statement should not be something that is achievable but something we work towards to. I think for the most part Komodo has done what is set in the vision statement (not thousands of chains) @Audo

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Also it is way too long, no one will remember what the vision statement is üòõ

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content:
Some that i like and are simple:

TED: Spread ideas.

Author: Audo#5667
Content: I agree, but I also think we must first find a longer form vision statement and then once we are happy with it we think of a way to condense it into a single sentence.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: One other thing to consider, we dont want to confuse  a goal as a vision, a goal is a step towards the vision

Author: Audo#5667
Content: I remember jl777 once said how he envisions everyone to be running their own personal blockchain at some point. Maybe something close to that, also it refers to the multi-chain tech.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Komodo - Freedom to interact trustlessly

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: I like something like that, dont even need to mention blockchain or any of the other buzz words but something our users/devs/everyone can get behind. They may have different ideas about what the vision statement may mean but each wants to work towards that.

Author: Audo#5667
Content: I like that one @hyperDEX
